title: Business & Finance
text:
---

U.S. consumer prices rose sharply in March as the economic recovery gained momentum, marking the start of an expected pickup in inflation pressures.

---

Toshiba's CEO resigned under pressure from shareholders, a week after the company said it had received an acquisition offer from private-equity firm CVC .

---

Credit Suisse flagged around $2.3 billion in problematic loans in its Greensill Capital funds and said it had so far recovered $5.4 billion for investors.

---

Epic Games is now valued at $28.7 billion after raising more capital, funding that comes just weeks before the company heads to trial against Apple.

---

The S&P 500 rose 0.3% to close at a record, while the Nasdaq gained 1.1%. The Dow industrials fell 0.2%.

---

Nasdaq set the reference price for the public listing of Coinbase at $250 a share, which would give the cryptocurrency exchange a valuation of about $65 billion.

---

Gap is parting ways with its longtime credit-card issuer, Synchrony, and moving the business to Barclays .
